boardgame.name: Medieval Merchant
Pfeffersäcke
boardgame.description: Players secure valued markets via affordable trade routes between medieval cities while simultaneously forcing opponents into less affordable and less valued markets. The cities themselves have a variable number of spaces for players to develop business branches within, or alternatively establish new trade routes into wider reaching cities and towns. Players may generate income and risk losing dominance over a city, or add branches within a city that lower the value of your product but can award you with a stronger market influence. At the end of the game, the player with the most influence wins._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

1998 Rio Grande english edition. Shipping will be actual rounded up to nearest dollar. Local pickup available in San Francisco bay area. Note: the game has been sitting on my shelf for years without ever getting to the table (almost made it twice). I occasionally pull it out and look at it fondly but at this point I doubt it ever will. Yes, an altered re-themed version is apparently coming but you may prefer this one.
Minor shelfwear, otherwise in wonderful condition. Played a time or two.

Rio Grande (English) version of Goldsieber original. All components bagged and in absolutely mint, new condition. EXCEPT for the following: 1) Rulebook is heavily used. No rips and the staples are firm, but it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s been thumbed extensively. 2) Maybe 4 or 5 of each denomination of paper money (there are 30 of each total) are mildly dogeared, mostly from normal play. The rest are still mint. 3) There are about half of the white houses missing, so the game won_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t play six. It has all the other colors (plus a few spares), so up to five players will work fine. AND: 4) The bottom of the box has some damage. It has the usual white corners from normal shelf wear, but the biggest problem (and the reason it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s listed as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Good_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and so cheap) is that there is humidity damage on about 1/4 of the bottom of the box. This means the paper outer is wrinkled and has lifted a little. Note that the box integrity is 100% whole, and that the paper outer is still sealed at the edges and will not come away or peel off. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m only listing it in detail because I know how pedantic and annoying I am, and I expect most of you are the same. Any questions, please geekmail. Shipping however you like from zip 11377. I only ever charge actual shipping costs.
